metadata.name: English Dictionary Definitions for RAT
metadata.description: English-English dictionary sentences as episodes for InsightSpike
metadata.purpose: Use sentence transformer embeddings with FAISS for insight detection

COTTAGE: A cottage is a small house, particularly a traditional or old-fashioned house in the countryside.
Cottage cheese is a type of soft white cheese made from the curds of skimmed milk.
The word cottage often evokes images of thatched roofs and gardens in rural England.
Many people rent a cottage for their summer holidays in scenic locations.
In fairy tales, cottages are often where woodcutters or witches live deep in the forest.
SWISS: Swiss refers to anything from or related to Switzerland, a country in central Europe.
Swiss cheese is a generic name for several varieties of cheese that resemble Emmental cheese, with characteristic holes.
The Swiss are known for their precision in watchmaking and their neutrality in international conflicts.
Swiss banks have historically been known for their secrecy and security.
Swiss chocolate is considered among the finest in the world, with brands like Lindt and Toblerone.
CAKE: A cake is a sweet baked dessert that is often decorated and served at celebrations.
Birthday cake is traditionally served with candles that the celebrant blows out while making a wish.
Cheesecake is a sweet dessert consisting of one or more layers with a mixture of soft cheese, eggs, and sugar.
The phrase 'piece of cake' means something is very easy to accomplish.
Wedding cakes are often elaborate multi-tiered constructions decorated with icing and flowers.
CHEESE: Cheese is a dairy product made from pressed milk curds, produced in a variety of flavors, textures, and forms.
The process of making cheese involves curdling milk using rennet or acid, then aging the resulting curds.
Common types of cheese include cheddar, mozzarella, Swiss cheese, cottage cheese, and cream cheese.
The phrase 'say cheese' is commonly used by photographers to make people smile for pictures.
Cheese is rich in calcium and protein, making it a nutritious food when consumed in moderation.
CREAM: Cream is the thick white or pale yellow fatty liquid that rises to the top of milk when it is left to stand.
Ice cream is a frozen dessert made from cream or milk, sugar, and flavorings, churned while freezing.
Whipped cream is cream that has been beaten until it is light and fluffy, often used as a topping.
The cream of the crop refers to the best of a group of people or things.
Face cream is a cosmetic product used to moisturize and protect the skin.
SKATE: To skate means to glide along a surface, typically ice or a hard floor, using ice skates or roller skates.
Ice skating involves moving on ice using metal-bladed ice skates attached to shoes.
A skateboard is a board with wheels that people ride by pushing with one foot while balancing.
Figure skating is a sport in which individuals perform jumps, spins, and other movements on ice skates.
The phrase 'skating on thin ice' means to be in a risky or dangerous situation.
WATER: Water is a transparent, odorless, tasteless liquid that forms seas, lakes, rivers, and rain, with the chemical formula H2O.
Ice is water frozen into a solid state, forming at 0 degrees Celsius or 32 degrees Fahrenheit.
Water is essential for all known forms of life and covers about 71% of Earth's surface.
The water cycle describes how water evaporates, forms clouds, and returns as precipitation.
Holy water is water that has been blessed and is used in religious ceremonies.
ICE: Ice is water frozen into a solid state, typically forming at temperatures below 0°C (32°F).
Ice cream is a sweetened frozen dessert made from dairy products such as milk and cream.
Ice skating is the act of moving on ice using ice skates, popular both as recreation and sport.
The phrase 'break the ice' means to do something to relieve tension or start a conversation.
Dry ice is the solid form of carbon dioxide, used for cooling and creating fog effects.
DUCK: A duck is a waterbird with webbed feet, a broad flat bill, and a quacking call.
To duck means to lower one's head or body quickly to avoid something.
A duck's bill is the flat, broad beak that ducks use to filter food from water.
Rubber ducks are toy ducks made of rubber or plastic, commonly used in bathtubs.
The phrase 'water off a duck's back' means criticism that has no effect on someone.
FOLD: To fold means to bend something over on itself so that one part covers another.
A billfold is a wallet, especially one that folds in half to hold paper money.
In poker, to fold means to drop out of a hand by laying down your cards.
Origami is the Japanese art of folding paper into decorative shapes and figures.
The fold of a newspaper is the crease where it is folded in half for display.
DOLLAR: A dollar is the basic monetary unit of the United States and several other countries.
A dollar bill is a banknote worth one dollar, featuring George Washington in the US.
The dollar sign ($) is a symbol used to indicate various forms of currency.
The phrase 'bottom dollar' means one's last dollar or final amount of money.
Dollar stores are retail stores where most items cost one dollar or a similar low price.
BILL: A bill can be a statement of charges for goods or services, an invoice requiring payment.
The bill of a bird, especially a duck's bill, is its beak used for eating and preening.
A dollar bill is paper money, with denominations like one dollar bill, five dollar bill, etc.
A billfold is another name for a wallet, designed to fold and hold bills.
In legislation, a bill is a proposed law presented to parliament or congress for discussion.
NIGHT: Night is the period of darkness between sunset and sunrise when the sun is below the horizon.
A night watchman is a person who keeps guard during the night at a building or property.
Nighttime is the time between evening and morning when it is dark outside.
The phrase 'night owl' refers to a person who stays up late or is most active at night.
Night vision is the ability to see in low-light conditions, naturally or with technology.
WRIST: The wrist is the joint connecting the hand with the forearm, allowing flexible movement.
A wristwatch is a watch worn on a strap or band around the wrist.
Wrist injuries are common in sports and can include sprains, fractures, or carpal tunnel syndrome.
The pulse can be felt at the wrist where the radial artery passes close to the skin.
Wristbands are bands worn around the wrist for decoration, identification, or to absorb sweat.
STOP: To stop means to cease movement or activity, to come to a halt.
A stopwatch is a handheld timepiece designed to measure elapsed time from a particular starting point.
A stop sign is a red octagonal sign requiring vehicles to come to a complete stop.
The phrase 'full stop' is another term for a period in punctuation.
A bus stop is a designated place where buses stop to pick up and drop off passengers.
WATCH: A watch is a small timepiece worn typically on a strap on one's wrist.
To watch means to look at or observe attentively over a period of time.
Night watch refers to a period of duty or vigil during the night hours.
A stopwatch is a special type of watch used to time races or other events.
The phrase 'watch out' is a warning to be careful or vigilant about danger.
BANK: A bank is a financial institution licensed to receive deposits and make loans.
The bank of a river is the land alongside or sloping down to a river or lake.
A blood bank is a place where blood is collected, stored, and preserved for transfusion.
Bank notes are paper money issued by a central bank as legal tender.
To bank on something means to rely on it or expect it to happen.
RIVER: A river is a large natural stream of water flowing in a channel to the sea, lake, or another river.
River banks are the sides of a river that contain the flow of water.
River boats are vessels designed specifically for navigating rivers and inland waterways.
The phrase 'cry me a river' means to complain excessively about something.
River deltas form where rivers meet the sea and deposit sediment in triangular formations.
NOTE: A note is a brief written record of something to aid memory or for future reference.
A bank note is a piece of paper money issued by a bank or government as legal tender.
In music, a note is a single tone of definite pitch made by a musical instrument or voice.
To take note means to pay attention to something or regard it as important.
A promissory note is a signed document containing a written promise to pay a stated sum.
ACCOUNT: An account is an arrangement with a bank to keep money there and access various services.
A bank account allows customers to deposit, withdraw, and manage their money.
To give an account means to describe or explain what happened in a situation.
The phrase 'on account of' means because of or due to something.
User accounts are profiles that allow individuals to access computer systems or online services.
